title: Shaun ‘Jaws’ Tan
text: Shaun is a helicopter pilot by training and stumbled into the world of data analytics during the COVID lockdown. When he’s not searching the high seas for pirates, he attempts to puts his data analytics skills to good use by trying to improve his (dismal) golf game.

title: ISSS608-VAA
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications. In this website, you will find my sweat and blood coursework prepared for this course.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed on the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7

Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

title: About
text:

Shaun Tan is the Chief Data Scientist at Wengo Analytics. When not innovating on data platforms, Finley enjoys spending time unicycling and playing with her pet iguana.

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed on the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The original design

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) + 
  geom_bar() +
  labs(x = "Race", y = "Count", title = "Histogram of Exam Data")




Critique of this histogram:

y-aixs label is not clear (i.e. count).
The bars are notsorted by their resepctive frequencies.
For static graph, frequency values should be added to provide addition information.

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The makeover design

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x=reorder(RACE,RACE,
                     function(x)-length(x)), fill = RACE)) + 
  geom_bar() +
  ylim(0,220) +
  geom_text(stat="count", 
      aes(label=paste0(..count.., ", ", 
      round(..count../sum(..count..)*100, 1), "%")),
      vjust=-1) +
  labs(x = "Race", y = "No. of\nPupils") +
  theme_grey() +
  theme(axis.title.y=element_text(angle = 0))

Warning: The dot-dot notation (`..count..`) was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `after_stat(count)` instead.

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The original design

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) + 
  geom_histogram(col = "#1b98e0",
                 bins=20) +
  ylim(0,45)

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The makeover design

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="black", 
                 fill="light blue") +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=mean(MATHS, na.rm=T)),
             color="red", 
             linetype="dashed", 
             size=1) +
  geom_vline(aes(xintercept=median(MATHS, na.rm=T)),
             color="grey30",
             linetype="dashed", 
             size=1)

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.




  ylim(0,45)

<ScaleContinuousPosition>
 Range:  
 Limits:    0 --   45

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The makeover design

d <- exam_data   
d_bg <- d[, -3]  

ggplot(d, aes(x = ENGLISH, fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(data = d_bg, fill = "grey", alpha = .5) +
  geom_histogram(colour = "black") +
  facet_wrap(~ GENDER) +
  guides(fill = FALSE) +  
  theme_bw()

Warning: The `<scale>` argument of `guides()` cannot be `FALSE`. Use "none" instead as
of ggplot2 3.3.4.


`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The original design

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point(size = 0.8) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))

title: In-class_Ex01
text:
The makeover design

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  geom_hline(yintercept=50,
             linetype="dashed",
             color="grey60",
             size=1) + 
  geom_vline(xintercept=50, 
             linetype="dashed",
             color="grey60",
             size=1)
